Content: President of the Maldives, Ibrahim Mohamed Solih who attended as the special guest of the National Day of Sri Lanka left the country last night. The Maldivian President and his entourage visited Sri Lanka for a three day state visit. The visiting State Leader called on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe following the 71st National Day ceremony and held bilateral discussions. The Premier hosted a dinner for the Maldivian State Leader. The Maldivian President met with President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s House. The visiting State Leader praised President Maithripala Sirisena’s commitment to bust illegal drug trafficking. The President also hosted a luncheon for his Maldivian counterpart at the President’s House. Concluding his three day visit, President Solih left for the Maldives at 8.20 p.m. from the Bandaranayake International Airport.
